summary: This document is a summary of monthly charges for an AT&T Wireless account, detailing the billing cycle, payments received, and current charges. It includes information on service usage, taxes, and fees associated with the account, as well as options for electronic fund transfers and customer service contact information. This document details the voice and data usage for a specific phone number associated with the Epstein case. It includes records of incoming and outgoing calls, text messages, and associated charges over a specified period. The document is significant as it provides insights into communication patterns relevant to the investigation.
keyFacts: The billing cycle began on September 12, 2004, and ended on October 11, 2004.
The total current monthly charges due upon receipt are $41.58.
There is a credit balance of $24.33 on the account.
The document includes various service charges and taxes totaling $11.93.
The document contains detailed records of phone calls made and received, including timestamps and locations.
Multiple calls were made to and from locations in Florida, particularly Lake Worth and Palm Beach.
The report includes charges for voice and data usage, indicating the frequency of communication.
There are numerous instances of incoming calls, suggesting active communication during the specified dates.
The document is part of a larger set of records that may be relevant to the Epstein investigation.
